definition: Ryūkyū/refers to the Ryūkyū Islands 琉球群島|琉球群岛[Liu2 qiu2 Qun2 dao3] stretching from Japan to Taiwan/Liuchiu township in Pingtung County 屏東縣|屏东县[Ping2 dong1 Xian4], Taiwan
Ryukyu Islands/Okinawa 沖繩|冲绳[Chong1 sheng2] and other islands of modern Japan
Liuchiu township in Pingtung County 屏東縣|屏东县[Ping2 dong1 Xian4], Taiwan
(bird species of China) Ryukyu robin (Larvivora komadori)
Ryūkyū Sea/refers to the Ryūkyū Islands 琉球群島|琉球群岛[Liu2 qiu2 Qun2 dao3] stretching from Japan to Taiwan
(bird species of China) Ryukyu scops owl (Otus elegans)

sentences.english: The languages were severely suppressed in education by the Japanese government.
sentences.chinese: 日本政府严格限制了琉球语在学校的教学和使用。

sentences.english: The history of Han literature on Ryukyu Islands is a topic that no body has studied yet.
sentences.chinese: 琉球汉文学史是一个尚无人研究的课题。

sentences.english: Japan seized Ryukyu in 1879 and changed its name to Okinawa Prefecture.
sentences.chinese: 1879年，日本吞并琉球并改称冲绳县。

sentences.english: Okinawa was, by itself, an independent chain of islands.
sentences.chinese: 琉球本是一群独立的岛屿。

sentences.english: In the Ming and the Qing Dynasties, Ryukyu had close vassal relationship with China.
sentences.chinese: 明清时期，琉球是一个与中国关系极为密切的藩属国。

sentences.english: China had the suzerainty over Ryukyu since Ming Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 自明朝以后，中国对琉球一直拥有宗主权。

sentences.english: Most of the Kumemura wanted war with Japan during annexation.
sentences.chinese: 大多数华族琉球人在日本吞并战争时被通缉。

sentences.english: It will then cross Japan's Ryukyu Islands and curve southeast through the Pacific Ocean.
sentences.chinese: 然后再绕经日本琉球群岛，再往东南方绕经太平洋。

sentences.english: Then let the US troops rule these islands like Okinawa.
sentences.chinese: 然后让美国军队统治这些岛屿，就像琉球那样。

sentences.english: The Ryukyu Current is a northeastward and western boundary current east of Ryukyu Islands.
sentences.chinese: 琉球海流是琉球群岛以东一支东北向的西边界流。

sentences.english: The Ryukyu Current is a northeastward and western boundary current east of Ryukyu Islands.
sentences.chinese: 琉球海流是琉球群岛以东一支东北向的西边界流。

sentences.english: Through the point of departure of RyuKyu, Japan began to walk the way of enslaving his neighbors.
sentences.chinese: 日本正是以琉球为起点开始走上奴役东亚邻国的道路。

sentences.english: Did China help Ryukyu during the invasion?
sentences.chinese: 中国帮助琉球抵抗侵略了嘛？

sentences.english: They settled in "Kume Village", Ryukyu, lived and multiplied generation by generation.
sentences.chinese: 此后便定居琉球之“久米村”，世代繁衍生息。

definition: Korean Goryeo dynasty, 918-1392/Korea, esp. in context of art and culture
Ryukyu Islands/Okinawa 沖繩|冲绳[Chong1 sheng2] and other islands of modern Japan
Tsushima Island, between Japan and South Korea
Luzon, island of the Philippines/the Ryukyu islands
former southernmost province of the Chinese Empire, now northern Vietnam
Champa (Sanskrit: Campapura or Campanagara), ancient kingdom in the South of Vietnam c. 200-1693
old term for Sulawesi or Celebes 苏拉威西
